page.title: 15BIRCHLEY STABLES, COVENTRY.
page.content: The premises consist of 11 stables, an office,a tool store,a tack store and a barn.There are 12 acres of land with the stables.There is a small paddock for beginners,the rest is used for grazing and hay.There is no mains water or electricity. There are 16 horses mostly Welsh Cobs,being most suitable for lessons. The horses are 5 yrs old before being used for lessons.The horses are not bred at the stables but bought from auctions.They are cared for by volunteers there are no paid workers. The cost of feeding a horse is about Â£7 per week.The horses are shoed every 3-6 weeks at a cost of Â£14 each.Vets bills cost about Â£10 per week.Hourly lessons cost Â£3.50 for children and Â£4 for adults.About 100 people have lessons each week.Each year the stables are inspected by the D.of E.
